My girlfriend and I had a very nice dinner at 089, on a recent Sunday evening in da Bronx.  There was a little bit of a wait, so we sat at the bar and were brought to our table before we finished our first glass of wine.The main dining room of the restaurant is very cool looking.  There is a large skylight above, and the natural light lends a nice ambience to the room.  The ceiling is very high and there is also a second level with seating.  One large wall is decorated to appear as the exterior of an Italian building, with street-style posters of upcoming events, ads for politicians, etc.  It actually reminded me of my time spent living in Italy.The specials sounded great, so we ordered one appetizer with shrimp, scallops, zucchini and bread crumbs with a nice light pepperoncino sauce which was delicious.  Our second appetizer was the cold antipasta with cured meats, olives, cheeses, and mushrooms, which were all good, and looked very nice on the serving board.  For an entrée I had the baked rigatoni with salami, egg, meatballs, and mozzarella, which I loved.  My girlfriend had the special pasta with lamb which she enjoyed as well.  We shared a strawberry cream tart for dessert, which was very nicely presented and tasty.  The service was friendly and just attentive enough.I will definitely be returning to this restaurant, and I recommend you go and check it out. You can't miss it, there's a blue vintage Fiat 500 parked on the sidewalk in front of it.

Awesome service, great atmosphere and great food. I heard that parking was going to be a challenge but I found a spot right behind Arthur Ave. Only 4 stars because I only tried one pizza which was amazing and I would like to go back and try a entree.

Really delicious food and impeccable service. The atmosphere is also something to be experienced, as the huge, sky-lit dining room is a complete surprise when walking through the unassuming storefront exterior. Best Italian I've had on Arthur Avenue!

I do not know if it was just a bad night they were having last night, but the food was not good. The Mafalde were over cooked which made them sticky. I do not think they were properly drained either because they were watery underneath.The Ragù Salernitano was just a cluster of weird. It tasted like chef boyardee. The potatoes in my chicken dish were under cooked with the cornish hen being edible but not impressive. Worst part is we weren't even asked why barely touched dishes were being being taken back. The Branzino was fine so I wonder if this was just a problem with the pasta line. Either way, never going back. Sad because I really like the atmosphere. It feels like you're in an Italian piazza.

Dining here wasn't memorable. Only thing I remembered was the long wait before being seated. I wasn't expecting being seated right away for dinner on a Saturday night with no wait, but if the food was fantastic I wouldn't mind one bit. Plenty of places are.We came here towards the end of the night, but I don't believe that's really a good reason to "run out" of an entrée on your menu. Since the item is a regular entrée it should be available even towards the end of the night. If it was a limited market priced item, easily understandable if they are out. Moving past that thought of what we wanted and not getting it, we ordered two other entrees that were again simply not memorable. I definitely will not be coming back, only because there are so many other places to try on Authur Ave.I can understand this place is a classy spot and more on the higher end of fine Italian dining and I can appreciate that. They would have scored better if I didn't come in having a higher expectation.

We have been dying to experience the Italian-ness the tis Arthur Ave and finally made it up there. We were told to try Zero Otto Nove from a personal recommendation. There are so many pizza and Italian restaurants over there I really appreciated a personal rec. OH MAN was he right! This place is so perfect, I'd travel from anywhere to come back.  The service was impeccable. So gracious and respectful, kind of felt like an old school royalty treatment. I may be mistaken, but I believe the waiters were speaking Italian. And that just threw me into wonderland. The inside ambiance is very calm and relaxing, some wallpaper bricks along the back and what appears to be a private upstairs for parties. There were young people on dates like us, there were a lot of families. The food was to die for. I'm not kidding. I'd die happy with that pasta dish being my last meal. I had complete order envy because my boyfriend ordered this rigatoni pasta with meatballs and spicy salami thing. The pasta was PERFECT, the sauce was PERFECT. I was so jealous. I ordered a white pizza and it was good, but not as good as I bet a regular pizza with sauce and cheese would have been. It's a little pricey, but very much worth it. I fell in love all over again with rigatoni, and cannot wait to go back.

Our first time for lunch this past Saturday food was excellent. We sat at the bar not the norm for us and had a great time chatting with the bartender a young fella from Albania. I had the veal with fava beans and mushrooms my wife had the pasta with butternut squash both were awesome. Looking forward to trying for dinner soon.

I came across this place by chance since my friends and I were craving pizza and this was the first place we saw after leaving a bakery a cross the street. I am really glad we decided to come in because although at first it is really easy to glance over, after the hostess brings you past the arched passage, you enter into a spacious, sky lit room. The whole feeing felt as if I was back in Seville (which is weird for an Italian restaurant) because of the spaciousness and the natural light. The decor of this place is amazing.The food is a little pricy, hence my four stars instead of five, but it was good. My two friends and I shared two of the "individual" pies, which was more than enough food, especially since they also gave a bread basket. The olive oil is also really good, with a kind of fruity flavor to it. The waiters are also all extremely nice and accommodating. Although I do think this place is pricy, I would recommend it, especially for people who see high prices as paying for the experience.

Staff was super attentive, From the hostess to the wait staff everyone was lovely. The ambiance was nice, bright and lively. My lower rating is because my pizza was undercooked, still doughy :( I would still go back there, just might order something else

This place is such a gem for the Bronx !! The service, the decor the food, everything is simply amazing. Went to have a casual dinner so opted for the bar, very comfortable space, I just wish it was a little more inside the restaurant, has a lobby feel to it. Had the four cheese pizza for dinner and it was delicious !! The cheeses blended perfectly and the crust was perfectly done. I added some spicy soppressata for a small kick and this made the pie just right !! I had the Sogni Cioccolato for dessert and wow my mind was blown, dark chocolate, nuttella and moist cake with vanilla gelato, it just went so well ! This place is a must!
The best grilled seafood I've ever had!  Excellent service. Seafood is fresh and cooked perfect. My family and I will make this our go to place when visiting the Bronx!

Used to be so much better. Been here a few times but the latest experience would probably make it my last. Service was prompt, probably a slow night, and we were seated right away. We ordered the Parmigiana di Melanzane and Calzone Napoletano. Both dishes were pretty good, but not great. Was cooked right but something was off in both dishes, seemed a bit overdone. We ended off with the chocolate dessert which previously came with gelato (says so on the menu as well) but was just the cake, which on previous experiences, tied the entire dinner together but this time, tasted like a cake you take out of the fridge after ignoring it for a week. Overall, this place is good but when you compare it with the prices, it's just okay.

We always like to try a restaurant twice before we make a decision. Zero Otto Nove does not disappoint!  The ambiance is amazing!  Having just come back from Italy, we felt like we were still there!  The food was delicious. Excellent meatballs!! Felt like home cooking!!  The waiter staff was very attentive. I only wished we lived closer!  Keep doing your thing Zero Otto Nove!! Salute! Ci è piaciuto! Torneremo!!!

This is my go to place for authentic and delish Italian pizza. It is so SOLID, I can inhale at least 5 of those pies  myself if I were on a pizza binge. The pie is thin and the crust is crunchy on the outside, soft inside.  As thin as it is, it's never soggy or we just don't allow it to rest long enough it get soggy.  The sauce is sweet but not overly. The mozzarella is nice, fresh, and creamy. Upon ordering the pizza, they bring it to you within minutes. We always get the Margherita pie and the pasta al forno. Those are our favorites and what we would recommend to anyone visiting this place. We've had their other pastas and we weren't impressed.  The restaurant itself is beautiful. It's a cute date spot if you don't mind the trek.
Hands down my favorite restaurant. The decor is amazing - just like you're in a courtyard in Italy!service is goodfree bread was amazingthe pizza is to die forFresh pasta = 5 stars
If you live in the Bronx and you want to eat in the Bronx this is one of the very few places that does disappoint you. I have tried a few of the pizzas, pastas, and appetizers and they were all good.

We were in the mood for some decent Italian and decided on this place on Arthur Ave. The area, fittingly referred to as "Little Italy" is a gem of a place and TZON fits the bill. The front of the house is not all that - with a front facing bar area, some tables, and an old car  on display out front. After walking through a narrow hallway, you enter the main dining area. Huge space decorated to resemble a street side Italian dining area. Very nice.The service is good and friendly. They are also pretty knowledgeable on their winelist which was a plus for us. The pizza was very good - freshly made in the brick oven, which we were seated close to. It was the saving grace. The pasta, on the other hand, was a little disappointing. We ordered the squid ink pasta and the cavatelli. The squid ink came ok but we were hoping that the pasta itself was made with squid ink. It was just standard dried linguini smothered in a squid ink sauce. The cavatelli was undercooked and dry. The staff explained that, with the exception of the pizza, things are cooked in small pans. No pots.Maybe this isn't the best place for pasta. But the pizza and wine are great!

decided to stop on Arthur ave for an authentic italian meal... served by eastern europeans and cooked by latinos.  ha.  our mistake for using Yelp in this case.  Pizza was very good, but the pasta was basic, and far too expensive for a very small portion.  you aint taking food home from here. they dont give you enough for that.  and the famed bread of arthur ave was not that great and was cold.  Nothing to see here, move on..

This was my first visit to Arthur Ave and per other yelpers, it does seem to be a more authentic little Italy vs. Manhattan. Fresh bread basket served alongside a jumbo bottle of table olive oil. The menu had a good variety between pizza, pasta and proteins. I was a bit thrown off when the looking at the price of pasta as it was more than the protein entrees?? Our group ordered apps- burrata, calamari (marinated and grilled, not fried) and antipasto plate. All were very fresh with on the smaller size portion wise. For entrees my friend and I split a Diablo pizza (hot sopressata, mozz and tomato sauce) and one of their specials which was a type of linguine with goat cheese, meatballs and tomato sauce. The pizza was awesome  and had a chewy salty crusty and spicy sopressata. The pasta was very al dente and could've used way more meatballs! Def felt skimped on these, they were so small but so tasty. With that being said, yes the the food here was delicious... I do not need to schlep to the Bronx for what I considered to be very comparable italian that's a bit closer to home. Oh and there's a second location of this place in flatiron! That being said, the overall experience here was great.
The rumors are true.Little Italy in the Bronx has the best Italian food in the 5 boroughs. This spot was absolutely amazing, would recommend for everybody to check it out.

Went there with few friends and the place rocks. Great decor and sitting arrangement well that counts for nothing....thats negotiable! Whats not? Yes the food. Their food tasted great i usually test a place through its steaks and bbq. The chef did a great job on my lamb, veal and steak combo (forgot its name) was the recommendation of the waiter.Good selections of wines and dessert menu! Highly recommended if you are in Arthur Av, Bronx!
Too bad it's far fro where I live. Beef stew can be slightly tough. But the sauce.The sauce!
Love his place!! Hidden dining room is so cute! Reminds us of Venice!! Hanger steak, ink pasta, salmon and more were all delicious!! And our server was awesome!! Lead us the whole way! Yum :)

This is a solid Italian place smack dab on Arthur Ave. I had the mafalde pasta with porcini, smoked mozzarella, and cherry tomatoes, and I did not miss having meat in my dish. The smoked mozzarella and porcini have enough umami to compensate, and the portions are large enough to satisfy. I'd happily come back, but you might find me ordering the same thing. I love curly pasta served with good sauces!

Good, not the best ever but a solid place.I had the osso bucco with risotto - rice was not arborio and a little overcooked.Angeline P. had the mafalde with mozarella and porcinis. This was the #1 best dish, blew everything else out of the water in my opinion.Other members of our party had short ribs and the squid ink pasta. The squid ink pasta was nice but the short ribs were forgettable.The bread was super good though, definitely fresh bread baked that day.A good place to have gone for my first meal in the Arthur Ave area, but I'm looking forward to more.

Omg!!! Stopped here for dessert and after dinner drink and had a wonderful time! The dessert was awesome espresso martini delicious but Anthony was the highlight of the whole night!! Definitely will be back!!

Found this place as we were going to the Train show at the NYBG, and had wanted to go to Arthur Ave. for a while. Amazing Food - very authentic.  The food was fresh - service was attentive and fast.  We felt like we were transported to Italy.  The pizza wasn't the best, but the Pasta's and the main dishes were very good.  We liked it so much we are going back again all the way from CT tomorrow (Thats 2 times in 3 days) -- says volumes for the place. Pros: Food, Wine list, quality and flavor, Kid friendlyCons: You have to wait to be seated (Sing of a good place)
Had squid ink and cuddle Fish Pasta and it was really original flavor and left great taste in your mouth

We had never been to Arthur Avenue before and we tried this place on the recommendations of other like minded folks. We were happy we went. Got there at 1:15 on a Saturday for lunch party of 4 plus a two year old. Waited 30 minutes for a 4 place table. Bar tender was a super nice friendly guy. He made the wait palatable.Had the arugula salad and egg plant Parmesan. Both were very good and I generally hate egg plant. Meals were great I had this chicken Parmesan type dish. Others had pasta and chicken scarparielo. Not one spec of fat or gristle in the meat. Just wonderful. Pasta is extra and like $12 for a kid portion (fresh). Bread is great and really makes the experience. Only Italian wines on the wine list with 1 California Cabernet available by the glass only. They have a few nice draft beers and give you the official brand glasses. Biggest downside is no off street parking, no California wines by the bottle and no Amex. They do take Visa and MasterCard for those of us that don't carry cash.
Loved it here! Great service and food. And reasonable compared to other Italian resturants in NYC.  The birthday song was my favorite and very entertaining. I went and downloaded it immediately!

Haughty, slow staff & bland food: I'm not a fan of Zero Otto Nove. I had dinner at Zero Otto Nove last night with 5 children ages 5-12 and 4 adults. We arrived at 6pm and were told we'd be seated in 5 minutes. It took 45, by which time the children were at their wits' end. These things sometimes happen, though, so we were looking forward to a delicious Italian dinner. Our experience took 3 hours in total, despite our exhortations that we wanted to move really quickly due to the children. I found the servers haughty, slow-moving, and mistake-laden. The two specials we ordered, a risotto and a black sea bass, were surprisingly bland despite multiple ingredients. There were no child-size dinners so we paid $20 each for plates of plain pasta with butter - which to the restaurant's credit, were the best part of the meal. The pasta was fresh and delicious. I was disappointed based on the reviews I read prior to my visit, but I'm not going to give the restaurant another chance.

Listen up NY.  Stay away--- cause its WAY WAY too good.  We've been to ITALY numerous times, eaten at all the top manhattan places.  THIS is HEAVEN.  At the bar, in the back, the food is delicious.  Period.  DRINKS are perfect.  Great wines... and GREAT staff.Hope to see you there (after we are seated :)As the 5 star says --- WOOHOO!  AS GOOD AS IT GETS!  And while you are there, shop around - this is NY as in keeping it real.  I am laughing at the RIP OFF review --- really?  You must not get around much...

This restaurant is fabulous.  The staff are terrific.  The waiter was answered all our questions with real knowledge of the menuThe water glasses were always full.I had the Portobello al forno.  It was very tasty and a nice portion.  Then I had the La San Matteo  pizza.  The crust was perfect thin and crispy.  The sausage was savory with good flavor  and what is not to love about sautéed broccoli rabe.  We went with a group of 15 and the service was excellent.  Everyone was served their dishes in  a quick manner which is not easy with such a large group.I would recommend this restaurant   It has beautiful decor

After visiting the Bronx Zoo, we settled in here.  What a terrific experience!  Geno, our server, was welcoming, great with the kids, and helpful with wine advice.  The ambience is gorgeous, and the food just as good.  The cold antipasto app, Pasta Al Forno, Pollo Boscaiola, Margerita & Diavolo pizzas were all fresh & top notch.  Definitely not a tired Arthur Avenue Italian retreat, this place was alive & fun--& the food delish!

If you are planning a private event do not go here!          We were ripped off and told different stories, the manager genti is not at all easy to work with!   We were told 15 min guarantee for the wine cellar and then they tried to move us to robertas meanwhile we had already done invites and the draw was the request of zero Otto. --  ok so we couldn't guarantee 15 people so we were moved to an open balcony area told no guarantee then come to find out day of they are STILL charging us a room fee AND A MINIMUM !  - this is not a room mind you and you are above everyone where the noise carries up and is loud , not conducive to a meeting!     They would not even let us do a Friday night and mind you this is a mid week night they made out like bandits.    Service was very slow!!! We had to tell the waiters to speed it up . Also the most we could spend was $125 a head all in and that is way more Than enough for an Italian meal- beer and wine and they could have changed the menu then but we were charged full price!     I have been to many Italian meeting meals were $35 a head unlimited beer and wine is more than enough! We also needed 2 separate checks and you would have sworn we asked for a miracle - we had to go through 3 separate managers- so shady.      Never ever again and I'm telling all my colleagues to never host a private event here ! It's like they didn't want our business and for sure Were not flexible.  I've been hosting programs for years and never in my life have I encountered a restaurant less helpful and accommodating.Look at Portofino in city island - huge private room NO FEE and manager / staff that goes above and beyond!
Good Italian restaurant on Arthur Avenue. Margarita pizza was very good. Meatballs too salty and pasta a bit over cooked. Sauce was excellent. I will try again.

Had delicious Italian food here once! Now I would not be able to tell you what I had to eat because I have a hard time pronouncing nearly everything on their menu. Eating here makes me feel classy, with their rich selection of wine. I'm no big beer lover, but that's ok, they had Coronas, which for a simple guy like me was exactly what I wanted. I've also been here for an open bar, and lord... That bartender knew how to get to me! She got me drunk enough for me to tell her that appreciated her cocktails, include a nice tip, and get my ass in a cab. Great price for its service!

The service is really nice. The waiter Is helpful and very cute. The dining space is amazing, just like you're enjoying mysterious Italy. Their food is also nice. I ordered their special pork shank, a little bit too salty but it's still great.Dessert is unimaginably soft and creamy. Awesome experience in total!

4/5 stars for me here. Finally had the chance to try this place on a Friday night after stopping at the Botanical Gardens. Arthur ave is such a gem of a place. For the full experience, come here during the day on a weekend when the yankees have a home game. You'll get the full experience. As for Zero Otto Nove, the place looks fabulous. There is a small bar right when you walk in where you can sit and have a drink and wait for the hostess to get your table ready. We did just that and had a glass of wine while we waited. We we were taken into the back dining room which is set to look like an outdoor space in Italy. The 20+ foot ceilings make the room look much bigger than it is. We were given menu's right away and explained the specials from a friendly, Italian,  waiter. We started with Parmigiana di Melanzane -  Eggplant parmigiana with fresh mozzarella & tomatoes. This was incredibly flavorful and not surprising was big enough for two of us. My date had one of the specials which was risotto with short ribs, peas and sun dried tomatoes.  I tried this, and like many risottos it was heavy, but it was delicious and provided lunch the next day as well! I had the Pasta al Forno -  Baked rigatoni with meatballs, sopressata, ricotta, mozzarella, sliced egg & tomato sauce. It was perfect! There was no room for dessert but I will be back to try more dishes. I would recommend you stop by as well. Until next time...

I decided to take my family to Italy today. No suitcases or planes needed when you have Arthur Avenue in your back yard in the Bronx, who needs the jet lag! We went to my favorite restaurant there, Zero Otto which is your round trip ticket to Italy thanks to Chef Roberto and staff,  you get magically transported to a grotto in Italy! The ambiance is off the charts with a dining room decorated with murals of Italian scenery, tall ceilings with skylights and the focal point of a beautiful brick oven gives you the feeling of sitting in a cafe in some back alley of Italy!The staff are always well dressed, very attentive and all have the Italian accents to lend to the experience ! You are never wanting for service here!After hearing the specials from our charismatic waiter, Geno, we decided to go with a classic  Margherita pizza to start. You have to try one of their  pizzas from a huge selection. Out of the golden brick oven, Cirilo  pops out the most perfect pizzas with a crunchy crusts, just the right amount of sauce, cheese and basil, Bellissimo!!Onto the entrees! My son had the Pollo Capriccioso. The chicken cutlet was perfect with mozzarella cheese, marinated tomatoes and pesto! He polished it off and almost licked the plate clean!My husband and I opted for the specials. The braised short ribs were amazing! So tender, no knife was needed!  And my Radiatore Cartoccio came in a steaming aluminum poach which when opened boasted the most scrumptious pasta dish! The radiator shaped pasta was combined with eggplant, mushrooms, tomatoes and cheese in a creamy sauce that was divine!Since we were stuffed at the end we opted for the Tartufo which was served up with fresh whip and berries! Complimentary Lemoncello cordials  were served at the end which just was the cherry on the top!This restaurant is more than just a place to eat great Italian cuisine, it is a trip to Italy for your total dining experience!!

Absolutely fantastic. A true example of quality, authentic, old world Italian dining. Selection of brick oven pizza, homemade pastas, and meats. You won't find two things on their menu that you'd expect from the definitional "Italian" restaurant. A personal favorite is the Pasta Al Forno, unlike any baked pasta you've ever had.

You walk through an unassuming door into a nice, quaint, narrow room with a marble topped bar and dark walls and ask for a table for two. Your hostess nods and leads you through an even narrower corridor. You're birthed out into a skylight-lit courtyard of a seating area that is an utterly pleasant surprise. Mural covered walls surround you and a HUGE wood burning oven wafts gentle heat and delicious aromas over the whole place. The pizza is tantalizing, but we'd just had pizza earlier that day. So I went with the Branzino and a Peroni (on tap, mind you.) "Bone in, or shall I filet it for you?" asks our Italian waiter. Bone in, obviously. Deconstructing a fish is half the fun of eating it! Dense, salty bread and slightly floral olive oil pique your hunger for the short wait until the 1000 degree oven produces your delicious dish. All in all, an affordable, amazing, pleasant experience all around. Bravo.

This was my first visit to Arthur Avenue and I want to start by saying it is definitely more authentic than Manhattan's Little Italy - and tastier too! We walked in and they put us on the list and indicated it would be about 40 minutes. We decided to wait at the bar. They placed the bar right at the front with only a small area for everyone to walk past so it is not conducive to waiting groups, and the bartender was extremely unfriendly. We ended up waiting about one hour and a half. I don't mind a wait but I do get frustrated when it's much longer than anticipated and even when checking in with the hostess a few times, they can't give me an update on the wait time.We waited quite a long time for the waiter at our table. We ordered a salad to start with that never showed up. Even after we reminded him he didn't remember the salad until we were halfway through our entrees, so we just had him take it off the bill and not bring it. I had a pasta special with burrata and truffles which was delicious. My only positive experience here was the food which is why I am giving it 3 stars. From the hostess to the bartender to our waiter, the customer service is extremely lacking (maybe because they get a lot of tourists). The restaurant is a poor design for waiting groups and there is no option for you to leave and come back (they merely call your name), so I recommend coming when you know there won't be a wait. It also seems that they struggle to provide good service during busy times. I doubt I will be back because I can get just as good Italian closer to home but if you're in the area at an off peak time I'd suggest it.UPDATE: I got a very nice note from one of the managers through private message apologizing for my experience and ensuring me that they want all guests to feel like family. Perhaps I will give it another shot soon then, see if things have improved and revise my review! Everyone can have an off night.
Probably the best Italian I've had. Really really enjoyed the atmosphere and the interior, very unique. Perfect end to a day in the Bronx.

Grew up in Westchester from 1955, never knew arthur ave existed.  Genuine New York at its FINAST-- now my most favorite neighborhood.Manhattan has lost it's grit its depth  its character it's soul, passion -- now spotless monochromatic elitist,   Serving and housing only the most wealthy .  Horrible  and very very depressing.My beloved daughter brought me here just 7 days ago. Last night was our 4 th visit. ( live out of state). Each visit we try new places and yelp reviews were outstanding here First the renovation is magnificent. Wonderful textured grotto "esque"  architectural touches, beautiful soft comforting colors, faux finishes  very nicely done  with a surprising  vaulted two story dining room ceiling--second floor balcony more intimate  more formal dining upstairs. Truly relaxing soothing-- my perfect ambiance.  Just perfect. A work of great love.The brick oven pizza and staff are right there in the corner with you --wonderful touch. The flour perfect dough perfect flavor light magnificent bread.  We very smarty ordered the grilled and baked hot antipasto veggies which we placed on top of our excellent tomato capers garlic kalamata olive and anchovy pizza ( 2 diff pies for 3 people= perfect )  our other was tomato mozzarella fresh sorpresatta  thinly sliced -- delicious but I loved the first.  No drinks ( had them at the arthur ave mkt while waiting) bill was very reasonable at $47.AND thank goodness they do accept plastic!Get there early. No reservations. Very very popular Enjoy!!!!

Excellent pasta and pizza. If they have the radiatore (radiator-shaped!), get it! Tastes very fresh and the "grill" soaks up the sauce. At $25, it was a bit expensive, but delicious. Pizza was excellent, true Neapolitan style. Can't go wrong with a margherita or one with butternut squash purée and pancetta. Yum! Great char and chew on the crust. Interior is a bit kitsch, what with its faux arches and back wall mural. Service was good. Could use some artisanal sodas or more non-alcoholic drinks. Worth a trip from Manhattan or Brooklyn: pizza can hang with Speedy Romeo's.

Came here for a late lunch after the Bronx Zoo.  We were seated promptly and given some warm delicious bread, olive oil on the table.  We ordered the Linguini alla Puttanesca ($13.95, Tomato sauce, black olives, capers & anchovies) and Ragu' Salernitano ($19.95, Pork skin braciola, beef braciola & meatballs slowly cooked in tomato sauce).  Sadly a both bad choices.  The linguini was cooked perfectly, however the sauce was overwhelmingly salty.  The Salernitano was interesting, but the beef braciola was too tough from being over cooked.  The pork skin wasn't memorable but the meatballs were divine.  I sort of wished we just had a Spaghetti and Meatballs type of dish.Service was attentive as our glasses were never empty.  Most beautiful thing about the restaurant is the Tardis like quality of being bigger on the inside - amazingly decorated like you were dining outdoors on the streets of Italy.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED Our dining group made an Arthur Avenue trip on 9/19/15 and I scheduled a luncheon at Trattoria Zero Otto Nove. Wow!!!! This place, a sibling of Roberto's a few blocks away on Crescent, displays the same super special , exquisite cuisine of Salerno, Italy. It is light years above and away from a typical "red sauce joint".I suspected that a great meal was awaiting our group because the bartender made me a perfect Espresso Martini which I enjoyed while waiting for the entirety of our group to arrive. The Martini was a harbinger of great things to come.Dishes our group loved included Linguine in Squid Ink,Orata Fish with Clams Baked in Foil, Pasta Puttanesca, Meatballs with Polenta, Ragu(Sausage, Meatballs, various Bracioles and Pork Skin) and Wood-Fired Pizzas. Service was attentive, prompt, efficient and even.....kind. The waiter was patient enough to go around the table explaining the Italian language items each of our fifteen diners ordered so that we could settle the check properly. One of the most remarkable facts to know about "Zero" is that the prices are VERY low for this type of quality.Run ......do not walk back........to Zero Otto Nove!!!!!!

My extended family, 10 of us, have met here twice for Sunday lunch.  We have a great time here. Food is great, service is so nice,friendly, and professional.  It was my dad's birthday last time and the music they played with his birthday candle cracked us up. Our group ordered seafood, meats, fish, pasta - everyone was happy. No reservations is a drawback. Restaurant in daytime was bright, with a spirited noise level. Love the wall murals and posters.

My family and I visited Zero Otto Nove for lunch a couple of weeks ago and had a great experience. Upon entering we walked down a short hallway through to a cozy room with a sun roof and a brick oven crackling over to one side. They most definitely aced the "homely" feel with decor that transports you straight to Italy (or what I assume is Italy, I've never been there to know for sure but I'll trust their judgment ;) ). Our waiter, Geo, was very professional and attentive, and eagerly explained any menu items that we didn't understand. The bathroom was also very clean, which is always a great sign.I wasn't too hungry so I decided to have the polpettine, polenta and caprino antipasti & insalata di arugola. I absolutely loved my dish. So much so that I haven't stopped thinking about it and I'm definitely having it when I go back again. I took a few scallops & shrimp from my husband's grigliata di pesce and they were pretty good, too. The table had also ordered some ciambotta which was alright but I wouldn't say great. Now, the bread was great but it would've been even better if they were warm. Overall I definitely enjoyed my experience here and I'm very eager to go back and try more of their menu items.

I heard so much hype about this place, I couldn't wait to try it. This restaurant is both spacious and beautiful, it is almost easy to feel like you are not in the Bronx or NYC at all while dining here. Definitely got the vibe that this was a bit on the sophisticated side. You know when you're in a truly authentic Italian restaurant because they don't offer things like "penne ala vodka" or "chicken marsala." I ordered the mafalde e cici which had so much going on, but I appreciated that it was not a dish loaded up with cream and cheese. It had chick peas, a bit of cheese, bread crumbs and pancetta, pretty good. Extremely filling, I had to take most of it home for leftovers, the food is definitely great.I have to minus one star because this was an insanely uncomfortable dining experience. All of the male waiters, about five, literally lined up a few feet from our table and just watched us. I get that it was the afternoon, nothing to do, but we felt so uncomfortable being stared at the entire time we were sitting. It's not like anyone came running over if we DID need something, so why post up there? Go do something! We had four different people wait on us, not sure who our actual waiter was. They all kept speaking to each other in another language which is fine, but only added to how self conscious we felt while being stared at during our meal.

I expected a lot more from this place.  I found myself in the Bronx last weekend, and what better place to go for lunch than this well respected old school Italian spot in the Bronx's little Italy?We were a party of two and decided to start with the Cozze alla Marinara  (mussels in a garlic red sauce.)  The flavor of the sauce was absolutely delicious, but every single mussel was way too chewy and grainy. We also were served a plate with 3 closed shells which are known to be bad mussels and not safe to eat.  I understand this happens, but 3?!  Moving on, we also ordered the Polpettine, Polenta & Caprino for appetizer which is basically 4 small meatballs over two "cake slices" of polenta dressed in a red sauce and goat cheese.  I was excited for this, but they completely overcooked the meatballs to the point of no return.   And our last appetizer was the arugula salad with fresh squeezed lemon, olive oil & shaved parmigiano reggiano.  Spot on.For pizza we asked the servers their opinion on what's best since we have never been here.  They were VERY selling on the "La Riccardo" and told us we would not be sorry if we ordered this one.  Well, I was sorry.  This pizza is basically a butternut squash puree, smoked mozzarella, spicy pancetta & basil. Sounds good, but it truly lacked flavor.  I found myself wishing I had a balsamic reduction or even some sriracha to put on top because it just wasn't satisfying my craving for that delicious pizza I expected.  To be fair, the servers were very wonderful and the house wines that we tried were delicious.  I might try this place again, but I definitely would order completely different appetizers and I would go with a pizza that has red sauce, none of that butternut squash business.
VERY good !Excellent place in Bronx Little Italy with a very nice back area with lots of natural light.Pizza was excellent.Definitely going back

I really like this little restaurant.  I have now been there twice for lunch and I thoroughly  enjoyed my meals both times.   The restaurant itself is nicely decorated to resemble a outdoor cafe in Italy. The restaurant is very bright due to a huge skylight in the middle of the room with very comfortable seating. There are a lot of tables in this small space yet you never feel that you're sitting on top of the people sitting next to you.The service itself is excellent, the staff is very attentive from the minute you sit down until you finish your meal.But, it's the food that is the real star here.  We started off with a shared appertizer called Polpettine, Polenta & Caprino which consisted of delicious small meatballs sitting on top of polenta and topped with crumbled goat cheese.  I have to be honest and say that after the first bite I regretted my decision to share this tasty little app and could have easily ate the whole thing myself!I followed up with a main course of Cavatelli al Tegamino which is basically cavatelli baked with mozzarella and fresh basil.  To me this is the perfect pasta dish...beautifully cooked cavatelli with fresh mozzarella and topped with a delicious red sauce. It was like Sunday dinner on a Friday afternoon!I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great place to eat in The Bronx.
Very nice meal. Perfect casual restaurant after a day at the Botanical Garden. Looking forward to trying their place in the City.

One of the better choices in the area. Be prepared for a wait in the small space. Food was excellent, service was good but slightly less so. One baffling lapse was a lack of coffee -- while they have espresso, my waiter refused to make me an Americano to accommodate me. Weird.

Wow! We came here toward the very end of their lunch seating and were presented with a lovely, leisurely meal. What struck me the most was being welcomed to continue dining through the hour break between lunch and dinner seatings, as the entire waitstaff ate a meal at a large family style table not too far away. What we had:1.Escarole Salad, which was fresh, well seasoned and came with marinated eggplant!2.Calzone Napoletana, which was just the right amount of greasy and was clearly made the proper way!3.Portobello Antipasto dish, which looked incredible.4.Antipasti with assorted meats, which made my heart sing!5.Pizza, which was big enough to share as an appetizer, but was so delicious, sharing didn't happen. Lunch for four was under $70.This is my new Arthur Avenue go-to!
The best pizza in NYC with a laid back atmosphere and wonderful service! Anthony the bartender is pretty great too! He makes a mean extra dirty martini!

I can't agree with all of the rave reviews.  I had lunch here on Sunday 8/23 and was not very impressed.  The long narrow hallway to the dining area gave you the feel of walking in an alley in Italy.  The hallway opened into a brightly lit eating area (thanks to beautiful skylight).  The space was not large but we were not cramped in our seating.  I loved the dining area and we were all looking forward to a wonderful lunch.We were immediately greeted and were quickly served beverages. However, our enthusiasm was quickly extinguished when we made a simple request to have our bread warmed.  Our server denied our request and haughtily informed us that the bread was baked fresh daily thus did not need to be warmed.  We assured him that we understood but we liked our bread warmed and we were again denied.  I never expected this from a dining establishment that clearly wanted to give the impression that they catered to their guests.  A small incident but it soured our experience from the start.One person in our group asked for something not on the menu ( some restaurants will make you a dish upon request).  It is understandable if an establishment does not provide this service (Zero Otto Nove is one that does not) but again the response to our request was rude.We finally made our selections.  I can't say the food was terrible but it was nothing to rave about.  The Margherita pizza was okay but the salad was underdressed or possibly not tossed well.  I had a seafood risotto that again was not bad but was nothing exciting.  I would skip Zero Otto Nove.  They seem very impressed with themselves and a bit snobby.  There are so many other choices in the neighborhood that don't make you feel uncomfortable when making a special dining request.  We left Zero Otto Nove unimpressed and disappointed.

All four starts go to service!! In fact, I'd probably give it five but the food still does need to be reviewed.  The waiters were amazing - very courteous and eager to please.  I honestly have to say that I chose the place based on the pictures - they looked soooo yummy!!!!  Unfortunately, I didn't really find the place to be as good as I was hoping it was.  We tried the butternut squash soup and the stracciatella zucchini e uova - very interesting; both are broth based (I was hoping for a creamier butternut squash) and had good flavors.  We also ordered a Bistecca alla Salernitana and Linquini alla Pescatore.  The pasta was good but (and I really don't want to sound like a snob BUT) they probably ran out of big shrimp (because we found only one in the dish) and threw a bunch of tiny little thingies in there that they clearly forgot to devein (though I'm sure if the shrimp was a tad bit bigger they may have seen the huge black line that ran down its back). The scallops were a bit chewy and grainy actually.  The steak - very disappointed at round one of it (yes, there was around two) - we ordered it medium rare and upon arrival it was much more medium than anything.  It was also so very burnt that tasting it - quite frankly I couldn't.  The (amazingly sweet) waiters insisted to get us a new one.  Round two was much more acceptable - definitely medium rare and not at all burnt; though it was still disappointing that it wasn't seasoned very well (salt people! come on!) and by then we were so stuffed that we asked for it to go.  The simply wonderful waiters (yes yes, them again) offered us some Lemoncello on the house - very delish! good stuff! I maaaay try it again .. may be ...

This place was excellent. I've been to several hole in the walls on Arthur Ave over the past few months and this is my favorite. It is unassuming from the front but gorgeous once you walk in to the main dining area. It looks like you're in a cave in Italy. The food is also fantastic. We had the antipasti, a salad, a few different pasta dishes, and the fish special to share. The pasta was excellently done and the sauce delicious. The fish was also high quality and prepared extremely well. The wait staff were very attentive and the chef even altered one of the dishes to accommodate a member of my party's food aversions. The place is on the higher end of Arthur Ave prices but nothing outrageous and you pay for what you get. Can't recommend this place enough! Ample street parking all around.

I really doubt there could be a better Italian restaurant in NYC!  This is definitely our favorite one and the food has been consistently scrumptious throughout all our visits over the years.Just recently we went for a Saturday lunch.  There are no reservations so we came right as the place opened at 12 noon and got a good table in this beautifully decorated restaurant.  You really feel like you are in Italy when you dine here.We ordered Antipasto Freddo, Capricciosa pizza, Malfade porchini e provolo, and a heavenly strawberry cream dessert.  All of the food was so delectable that we kept on oohing and aahing- something the staff must here all the time!The service was perfectly attentive and professional- the way an elegant restaurant should be.Perhaps you already know that Arthur Avenue in The Bronx is the REAL Little Italy in NYC.  Strolling through this genuine Italian neighborhood with its many mom and pop stores, bakeries, markets, etc. is a real treat!And it is rather easy to get there by subway and bus.  Just take the D train to Fordam Rd/Grand Consorse and then the Bx12 bus (8 minutes) directly to Arthur Avenue.
My favorite pizza in the NYC area other than Waldy's Wood Fired Pizza in Manhattan!  Food, staff, and atmosphere are wonderful!
Atmosphere & food was wonderful. Handles groups well, had a secluded table for 8 of us. Kids had pizza which was great. The short ribs special was to die for.

Absolutely fell in love with this place. After a long day at the botanical garden this was the perfect place to have a nice filling meal. The wait was not too long considering we didn't have reservations and it was a Sunday afternoon. The decor was absolutely beautiful. I was with a large group so we ordered some pizzas to share and they were delicious, we also ordered the baby clams and they were perfect. The staff was incredible, extremely attentive and delivered the dishes with perfect timing and they were very sweet! I would like to come back again but with a smaller group so that I can order my own personal dish, everything looked so delicious but was limited to pizza my first time around.

We stopped here after a day at the Bronx Zoo and found a small municipal parking lot a couple of blocks away. This is a great spot for solidly good wood-fired pizza!Service: The waitstaff was attentive and polite. When we split an appetizer, they even divided it onto our plates for us. My only complaint is that they used our bread/olive oil plates for the app instead of swapping for clean appetizer plates. Well, one small second complaint - I asked the server if the "ham" listed on the pizza menu was prosciutto. He said it was - turns out it was not.Atmosphere: It's an interesting space, but the dining room is LOUD. If you're on a date, prepare to scream your conversation. It didn't bother us too much. Generally packed and loud = decent food, and this was also the case here. The pizza oven is visible in the center of the room.Our order: Pizza with mushrooms, olives, and "ham." Not prosciutto, it turns out. Little thin, rubbery strips that were pretty tasteless. Not even really salty at all. Not a fan. However, the rest of our pizza was great! The charred bits on the crust were heavenly, the sauce was good, and the mozzarella was high quality. Yum!We also got a meatball app with polenta, fresh basil, and goat cheese. Great flavor combo, well-seasoned meatballs. They could have been a bit more tender, but I'd order them again and I don't usually opt for meatballs.We also received bread and focaccia when we first sat down along with a bottle of olive oil. I was happy with the olive oil but wish the bread was warmed up even a little bit. Cold bread isn't as nice to dip. My daughter loved the focaccia, though.They gave us a booster seat - didn't need it but it's nice that they have them.Overall I was very happy with our meal and would definitely come back the next time we visit the zoo.
The ambiance was divine! Service was superb! Food was delicious and reasonable & fair price! Order the desert & pizza and it was perfection! New fave place!

Great food, space newly done, good service. The food was all excellent, not overdone American style. Pizza was charred but not burned, pasta was well done, al dente, appetizers were great. Authentic place, worth checking out.

This is our second visit to this restaurant and We love it! They sat us down right away even though it was a Saturday night. the wait staff was extremely attentive and helpful. The food is amazing! Ordered the polenta app with mini meatballs and the caprese salad to start. The cannelloni bean salad on that is the best. I ordered the al forno pasta that's baked in the oven. It's really the best pasta dish out there. I saw this restaurant on food network over a year ago and couldnt wait to try it. The ambiance is great and the devote is unique. We have made this place one of our usual spots.

I've been wanting to check this place out for a while and finally did!The decor inside is very nice, the walls are like scenes of Italy, and a sun roof to match. Service was very well, and they are very polite. They answer any questions and are helpful.Now for the food, I had something called al forno I believe? It had ziti, meat balls and egg. First of all I have to say they aren't Olive Garden, and it's literally Italian food, I even googled what I was ordering. It was interesting to finally have authentic Italian food, did I love it? Not exactly, but maybe it's because I expected something more Americanized. I didn't have an appetizers, but I did have a glass of wine that I enjoyed.Would I go back? Yes but perhaps for their pizza.
Hands down the best of the best right here...amazing amazing! MAKE sure you listen to specials and order their Margarita!
Wonderful staff great food. Tried the butternut squash with sausage  yummy.def worth going to the Bronx for

Like a few other diners we noticed in the restaurant, we came here after spending the day the New York Botanical Garden. It was a convenient drive from the gardens and on-street parking was aplenty on a Sunday evening.We arrived on the early side for dinner at around 5pm and were seated right away but by the time we left, the restaurant had filled up and many people were waiting for tables.The menus boasts lots of traditional Italian dishes. To start, we had the Grilled Octopus Antipasti special which tasted delicious but was served lukewarm which kind of weirded us out. Fortunately we suffered no gastric consequences of the lukewarm seafood. We had noticed the big pizza oven and we are kind of fanatical about pizza so we decided to try the Margherita pizza with olives and anchovies added. The pizza is a traditional Napoletana style pizza with a thin crust. It was very good but they charged us $5 for the add-ons which was steep.Service was OK at best but overall we left full and happy and for the sake of convenience I would recommend this restaurant to others visiting the area.

I came with friends for a late lunch to finish off a day spent at the NY Botanical Gardens in "da Brawnx". As others have said, the design of the place is deceptive. The bar area is rather odd on entry, giving a modernized feel to the old time Italian social club. The long alley leading to the back is successful in conveying a feeling of a small street in Southern Italy. We settled on Mafarde Porcini (which I had spied on another table on our way in), and a pizza with sausage and broccoli rabe. The winner was the Mafarde (dialect for "mal fatti" meaning badly made in Italian). The pasta was perfectly al dente, the sauce tasty, but light on the porcini. The pizza was also beautiful, but oddly lacking in flavor. In true southern Italian style, this was easily fixed by asking for hot pepper flakes, presented in a ramekin (so you know it is a standard item in the house!). Both dishes were well priced for the quality and portion size, and the house has a nice ambiance and terrific service. I would visit again if in the Belmont neighborhood, but there are options in Astoria offering better food. If i answer "why leave Astoria", this time it was was for the Frida Kahlo installation at the NY Botanical Gardens!

We started our experience with three amazing Martinis from the bar! The bartender was so kind he even charged my phone for me while we ate! The entire service was top notch. The waiters were very aware of the menu and made sure to make our experience wonderful!

We went to this restaurant on a friend's advice. It was our first time on Arthur Ave, so we do not have points of comparison but starting with this place was a real delight, and made us completely want to come back and adventure more in this neighborhood. The restaurant is so cute in the inside with a little Italian street decoration by the brick oven. The food was very very good and tasteful. We had:-margarita-caprese-capricciosa-the cirilo-pasta of the dayThe pizzas were delicious, especially the cirilo with butternut squash puree (instead of the traditional tomato sauce), cream of truffle, mushrooms and mozzarella. It was a very good surprise and it tasted so freaking good. The other ones were decent, but I believe we could find the same in other pizza joints. The pasta of the day was good but a bit pricey ($24). We would definitely recommend this place and will also come back! (It s a very cute place for a date :) )

Oh sweet baby Jesus. This place was fantastic when we went last night. It was a real crowd pleaser and I'm so excited it was recommended to me. I can't wait to go back.First things first. The decor is adorbs. They have the whole back dining room (which isn't very large, maybe 20 tables) painted to look like an alley in an old Italian city. The hallway you walk down, which disguises the kitchen, has a bunch of faux doors to make it look like you're walking down some back street. It's very squee but I liked it.Our server was awesome. Incredibly friendly and helpful. He had no problem reciting the specials again for us (and almost everyone ordered a special) and was just so pleasant he really enhanced our experience. We liked him very much.Now for the interesting stuff. Our meals. I ordered off the menu and was the only person who did. For apps we had the baked portobella with smoked mozzarella and the sauteed calamari. Everyone was pleased with the calamari and the baked 'bella was rad. It wasn't tough or chewy and the mozarella wasn't drowning the mushroom. I could have eaten that as my meal.For dinner I ordered the rigatoni with butternut squash puree, peas, and mushrooms. The rigatoni are HUGE and awesomely rustic. The dish was really tasty but in comparison to what my dining guests ordered I was disappointed. Their dishes were so out of this world delicious that my equally delicious but "safe" choice paled in comparison. My fiance ordered the short ribs cooked in a Peroni sauce with the most amazing roasted peppers I have ever tasted in my entire life. I nearly ate half his dish. And we still had leftovers. My FIL ordered the chop special (veal chop, lamb chop, hangar steak) with brussels sprouts and potatos. The lamb chop is what dreams are made of. Gah you can't go wrong with a perfectly cooked and seasoned chop. My MIL ordered the cavatelli which was piping hot still when we were finished with our meal. It came in a wonderfully seasoned tomato sauce with the most perfectly baked on layer of cheese.But the winner of the evening, in my humble opinion, was the pork osso bucco. Sweet heaven above, if I had ordered that dish you can bet no one was going to get a bit. The tomato sauce was the most perfect definition of a bright, acidic, summer tomato with the most robust flavor I've encountered. The meat literally fell off the bone and the risotto it was paired with had the perfect balance of chewy and creaminess to compliment the tomato sauce.Literally going to be dreaming about that osso bucco for the rest of my life. We didn't have any dessert because we were so stuffed from dinner. But the menu looks tasty - lots of classic Italian favorites on there.

An amazing find in the heart of Little Italy, Bronx. Some people say this is the real Little Italy and I would agree with them. Trattoria was a super find, great ambience perfect for celebrations, dates and special occasions. We went with the server's  choice of pizza with butter nut squash puree and truffle oil, and we added mushrooms on top....and the result was simply deliciois. The truffle oil brought out such amazing flavors we were left liking our  fingers!! Definitely the best brick oven pizza we have EVER had!! Would  definitely recommend this place. The pastas looked yummy too! Great service  and friendly  staff to boot!!
Very good authentic Italian food. Atmosphere is rustic and romantic. Like your in a piazza in Italy.

Was there for lunch Sunday. Very interesting. Small unassuming store front, then you walk through the bar area, then into the back room which is like an Italian grotto. A little noisy due to poor acoustics. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. Menu is excellent. We only had some small dishes and a pasta dish but all were presented nicely and tasted wonderful. The raggatoni and meatballs was great. Good martinis as well. I will go back for sure.

We've always enjoyed our meals at this very authentic Italian trattoria in Little Italy in the Bronx. The pizza is very crispy crust and very tasty. Other dishes are always well flavored. The  room is charming and you feel like you're dining outside in a courtyard   In Italy.  Would gladly return.

One of my favorite Italian restaurants of all time...and as you walk in this restaurant, you're quickly deceived by its size and decor. Walking down the corridor to the dining area, you are taking by surprise as you make it through little Italy's town. The scenery is open, rustic and it seems like you're actually in Italy. The brick oven pizza is the first thing that hits you. It's right in the center of town and you're watching the bakers making a variety of amazing brick oven pizza. The wine, the waiters and food is top notch. All the dishes are made to order and nothing is incomplete. Waiters are knowledgable about the menu and will pair the wine for you. The fish dishes are really great. They're wrapped in foil and served incredibly fresh. Chef Roberto Paciullo serves you the best authentic Italian food and uses his traditional methods with the freshly made pastas. Molto bene.

Whenever I get a little homesick for Italy, I go to Arthur Avenue - and Trattoria Zero Otto Nove is where I go to for pizza. Apart from the classics, they have some unusual pizzas. The Cirilo (butternut squash, truffle oil, mushrooms and mozarella) is delicious.

It was crowded and some of the previous reviews were very encouraging.  My husband ordered the pasta short rib special and I ordered the spicy chicken scarp.  We also got the cauliflower side.  Everything was so salty we'll never be back.  We really wanted to like it but when the chef uses so much salt it's a no go.  I suggest if you do go ask for as little salt as possible.  The place is pretty and the staff welcoming but it's the food that brings you back-sorry!
Excellent food and ambiance, feels like you walked right into a piazza in Italy. Their pizza was as delicious as pizza can get!

This place is adorable! And the food is good - I wouldn't say its the best Italian that I've had but it's authentic and tasty! For the price, I wouldn't say its the best value either. But it's a good place for a date night or dinner with group. They have a cute second floor indoor 'terrace' that overlooks the main floor and the open oven area where they roll the pizza!

My husband and I just popped in after a picnic at Botanical Gardens, just got a pizza and some wine....AMAZING.  We got the butternut squash puree with truffle and mushroom pizza and it was ridiculous, I now have cravings.  Definitely one of the best pizzas I have ever had.  We need to go back and really have a nice dinner, and that pizza again (oh that pizza!)
Beautiful venue and great food. Anthony the waiter is awesome.

WOW. just WOW.By far, the best Italian restaurant I've been to in NYC.... across the boroughs!They don't take reservations, but whatever the wait is, it's worth it... and you can wait with a drink which does make it more bearable.The ambience is mellow and very cute. As you make your way past the bar, it's like you're entering a small Italian village secret where all the locals come to eat BOMB-ASS food.I had the pasta special of the night and if that's any reflection of what's on the regular menu, then you will find me here whenever I get a hankering for Italian food.I'm not sure what it was called but it was presented in foil, the waiter broke this pouch and plated it in front of you STEAMING out with fresh pasta (unsure of the shape's name but it was slightly spiraled and looked like little harps), pureed butternut squash, clams, shrimp, garlic and parsley. I demolished it! The portion was large, but as with most REALLY GOOD pasta dishes, it all goes down until you stand up and realize you've eaten too much!Wait staff was courteous, friendly, helpful and patient. They really helped make the meal an event as they were attentive enough, but not awkwardly so.There's so much more to try and am so excited to come back for my next meal!!! Bravo!
This is the kind of place that will get you laid. Good food and the ambience is on point. Some of the staff are rude but thats just how these albanian guys who want to be italian are.

Love the place!! The food is amazing. Saturday night my boyfriend and I were starving. We had heard about how good this place was from friends that live in the Bronx. We live in Yonkers so we aren't too far. We had the margarita pizza and it was delicious. The cheese is so authentic tasting and was one of the best I ever had and I'm Italian. For dinner I had the short ribs and he had the linguini pasta with calamari. The short ribs were tasty and filling. I really enjoyed them. My boyfriend didn't care for the calamari but liked the pasta. For dessert we had the cannoli which was great and took a nutella pizza to go which was delicious. Overall we were happy with the food.The ambiance was beautiful in this little place. We were really impressed - it was nicer inside than we expected. While we ate there were two birthdays and it was nice how they celebrated the birthdays there. Very cute. Only two things are that are downsides to this place that stopped me from rating it a five are the prices - a little overpriced for the entrees. Second the free Italian bread they serve you on the table was cold. They should serve it warm would be ten times better!All in all I would definitely return and its worth a visit!
Always greast for pizza and pasta, wth a big assortment of salads and specials!

Excellent service, very good food. Had the Margherita pizza as an appetizer, perfectly made and cooked to perfection.  For a meal, had the Grigliata di Pesce.  Interesting to try, wouldn't be eager to order again, as there are more interesting meals on the menu.  Overall, a very positive experience, with a unique interior that made the meal even more enjoyable.
Totally fresh, food out within minutes, good service, felt like I was in Italy for a hour...fresh fresh fresh

Went for a birthday dinner with a party of 12 (took a little time to get us seated) but the place was very busy for dinner so make sure you get there in a timely manner. They also don't take reservations by phone!Food:- BREAD: i love the free bread they have at italian restaurants, especially when they are warm and tasty. sadly, this one was not warm. But when i asked for balsamic vinegar and parmesan cheese, they came and gave fresh grated parmesan with it. If you ask for extra bread, they bring out a second kind of bread that's also delicious.- PIZZA La Cirilo: delicious! the butternut squash puree gives it a really nice creamy flavor. not too salty and the mozzarella was delicious. and u can never go wrong with truffle. great non-tomato based pizza- Pasta al forno: i thought from the ingredients it would be a plain regular pasta that i could whip up at home, but it was really good! the sauce were savory and the meatballs were on point- Linguini al Nero di Seppia e Calamari: i was hoping for a squid ink pasta and they have a really great one! i tried both the spicy and mild and both are yummy. the calamari was good too. just be warned that the calamari isn't breaded/fried (thats the appetizer)ambience: dimly lit, very fancy/romantic interior.  very nice. but mood might get interrupted by the birthday song they sing, if you request it!Service: great service. all the waiters were on point. price: a little pricey, but worth it! (jusst be warned that the prices on the menu on yelp are a bit old so the real prices are a little higher)Overall, great italian food! check this place out!

Ive been here several times- each time outstanding. The decor is really cool and reminiscent of an outdoor cafe in italy. I love pizza & this plave has outstanding brick oven options. The service is excellent- a++++

This place is more for the ambiance than the amazing food, but once you step in here, its as if you are in Tuscany. The food is very good but its not the best Italian around. I would suggest to get the brick oven pizza here, which is tasty. For a date, sitting upstairs is more romantic and with a group sitting anywhere and splitting the pizza is a fun & economic idea in a beautiful setting.
We stopped in for dinner after reading about this restaurant on Yelp. Food, service and  ambiance was great. We'd go back.

1.Pasta al forno #deliscious , authentic , what Arthur ave signifies 2. Mahgerita pizza was good, but tasted under cooked and soggy on the inside, outside was well cooked with burnt spots.3. Pollo capriccioso, tasted like fried chicken..with tomatoes. It wasn't hot enough , like it was just cooked. The al forno tasted like it just came out the oven to the plate. The capriccioso does not come with any pasta, which I think it needed. It tasted OK. Chicken needed more flavor. I don't think it was seasoned.4. Dessert, biscotti, was very wet and mushy. I guess this is the texture it was supposed to be. Didn't like it5. Not a cheap place. Nice decor, and romantic ambiance. Would go back to try something else..and the al forno!
Love the decoration of this restaurant! The service was really good and my butternut squash pizza with truffle oil was phenomenal!! Definitely one of the best pizzas I've ever had.

I love eating here every time I go shopping to Arthur Ave. It's a very cute restaurant and the staff are super friendly. Everything I tried, including several pasta dishes and pizzas, was good. However, I hate to say that last time I went with some friends they ordered a seafood platter and it was awful. None of the seafood was fresh, it tasted like frozen cheap stuff, which I cannot understand when your restaurant is placed in a street with plenty of fish stores! Very disappointing, especially because the prize was worth a really fresh platter of seafood.
This place is absolutely beautiful. The service great! The food delicious and the priceless reasonable. This a great place to go with friends from out of town to show a beautiful side of the Bronx.

Fabulous dinner I need not say more, five of us came for dinner on Friday night with extremely short wait. Once the waiter shared the nightly specials I did not even need to look at the menu. I enjoyed a homemade fresh pasta special with sausage, and many other delectable items tossed in,  truly superb. Dinner cost including wine was around $50 per person.  Having stuffed ourselves with entrees we all shared a cannoli for dessert. Marvelous over all.

This place is really good...! Friday night I had Insalata Caprino e Pera with goat cheese and La Cirilo pizza with butternut squash puree, mushrooms & fresh mozzarella. Service was excellent, my water glass never was empty.The decor was awesome and I will come back.
Amazing food! Really great ambience and attentive service. I loved everything we had..the mussels...pizza...braised short ribs...just perfect. Will be back for a third time!

Are you kidding me?   What do you get when you blend a great ambience, gorgeous architecture, purely delicious food and great service.   You get ZON.  Fantastic Italian food and worth every single penny Make room for pizza and desert.   Remarkable restaurant.
Love Zero Ott Nove.  We are huge Roberto fans and this is actually a lovely place for families -- especially kids.  Food is fantastics and pizzas are amazing.  Staff is so friendly.
If you're looking for traditional and inexpensive Italian food in NYC this is a perfect spot! I've always been pleased with the service, meals, and wine selections

Excellent food and service on the Bronx's Arthur Avenue. Penne ala Vodka made off-menu for my babygirl, risotto with rabbit ragout, upscale chicken Parmesan with pesto and sautéed garlicky tomatoes, perfect pizzas with fresh mozzarella, garlic and arugula, a pear and goat cheese salad and a cappuccino that fueled me for the long ride home. Attentive, charming, perfect. We will return

Staff was great, restaurant is very nice. décor is very cozy. very Italian like and Im not even Italian. I was already going into this place knowing it was on the more expensive side. I have to admit that the food there was not to my liking. Its unfortunate too because everything else was great. Perhaps it was what I ordered. I had a steak that was drench in this sauce therefore I had no idea what the actual steak taste like. Almost as if they need to hide it or something. This all could have been me...restaurants wont always please EVERY single customer, I am one of them. Lesson learned, I would come back to this place but I will make sure to try their pasta....EVERY Italian place should make excellent pasta, right??
Dont see any options for gluten free--besides salad and meat.

Came here for lunch and let me say, for the ambiance alone, worth five stars. This place will easily impress a date. That said, the food was amazing hands down. Its too bad i cant give the Marguerita pizza six stars because it was that amazing. Had the pizza as an appetizer and Chicken Capriccoso as the main entree. Cooked well and very tasty. I regret not trying something else but i will definitely go back. Service was great too. Usually that the first thing I rate is the service but even if the waiter had been a snob (which he wasn't) i would of still given this place this rating. A must try if your in the Bronx!

I've heard so many good things about this restaurant I couldn't wait to try it for myself.  After dining here, I have to say it definitely lived up to my expectations. This place is the real deal - everything about it is what you're looking for in an authentic Italian restaurant. The decor is modeled after an outdoor cafe in an outcove surrounded by stone walls. Walking into the restaurant you're greeted by a vast wine cabinet and a small bar you can patron while waiting for your table. You walk down a long hall to get to the main dining area, which is very cozy and warm. There is also an upper loft area with additional tables. Service was great  - the staff was prompt, knowledgable, and friendly. The menu was a combination of classic Italian food with more modern dishes. The food was some of the best Italian I've experienced. I had the pollo capricciosa; the chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. They topped it with bruschetta and pesto which was a little different but delicious nonetheless. Definitely give this place a try - a must do if you're in Little Italy.

I'm in Long Island but frequent it.  It's probably my favorite restaurant in NYC.  It never disappoints--everything is good here.  A glass of Macallan 18 year is just $18 (about $28 to $36 everywhere else).  I treat myself to this only when I'm here.My favorite dish is the mafalde porcini e provola.The service is excellent.  The prices are excellent.  I always find parking a block away.Just go.  Pound for pound, when you consider everything from quality to variety to price, etc, it's probably the best place in the city.
Excellent!!! Service, food,ambiance, price!Waiters were great, explaining the specials, not pushing food on you. Can't wait to go backWe had a couple of the specials, Fantastic!

If you're looking for mediocre food served up in factory like fashion, you've found the spot. Our meal was very disappointing, beginning with the insalata de mare, a pile of rubbery, overcooked seafood that had been sitting around too long. The arugala salad was less than the sum of its parts. The pizza was nothing special. Surely, there is far better to be found on arthur avenue.

We were 6 people in our party.we did not order the pizza.Some of the dishes were great.pasta cooked in a bag was good. Butternut squash with the sausage delicious. Chicken Scarpiello had no taste and the salads were just ok.Good Service Very nice decor. IF I go back I would stick with the pizza.

I often bring visitors here to grab dinner but would go any night of the week if I could. It is very reliable with friendly service. The pizza is delicious - especially La Ricardo. However, any pizza is a good choice. The pizza is thin with a fluffy crust. But if you aren't in the mood for pizza, the pasta is good as well. For dessert (if you have room), I recommend the nutella pizza. It is nutella spread over the regular pizza dough - simple but delightful. There is also a great ambiance in the restaurant. When you first walk in, there is a bar and when you walk farther in, the space opens up. There is a high ceiling and the walls are painted like a Italian village. If you find yourself on Arthur Ave, Zero Otto Nove should be one of your stops!

I like Italian food so Arthur Avenue is one of my favorite places to go when I have a chance.  There are many Italian restaurants to choose from so I made the decision based on Yelp - Trattoria Zero Otto Nove had the highest rating with the highest number of ratings.There's a old school Fiat parked in front of the restaurant. As you walk in, you're greeted by the hostess and have an opportunity to sit at the bar if you need to wait for a table.  Bartender was courteous and friendly.  Service was prompt.  When your table is ready, you walk through a hallway / corridor until you reach the open dining area.  It's kind of a cool experience.  The dining area is huge and has a second level, which only makes the high ceilings for the dining area more dramatic.Food - ordered two of the five specials for the day.  The risotto with broccoli rabe and almonds was good, but wasn't worth the $25 they were charging.  Everything else on the menu seemed to be reasonably priced so I was surprised when I found this small plate of risotto being charged at $25.  Good, but not worth it.The short ribs were excellent.  Served in it's own gravy, the meat was tender and that melt in your mouth quality.  Well worth the $25 they were charging.The margherita pizza was OK.  I was lured by the fact that they use fresh mozzarella and homemade tomato sauce with tomatoes imported from Italy.  The sauce was actually a bit too sour for my taste, but the mozzarella was excellent.  The crust was just OK.Overall, a pretty good place to go if you're in the area, but I was a bit disappointed by the lack of value in the broccoli rabe risotto and the pizza.  The short ribs were good and worth every penny.  It is worth going back just for that.A bit of note if you drive to the area.  There are some shady characters that may act like parking attendants.  They'll ask you if you need parking and direct you to a spot.  I almost took a spot until something in my brain clicked and I realized that the parking attendant looked like a homeless guy.  I don't mind giving some change to a homeless guy, but I did pass by another guy who parked with the help of the homeless parking attendant and it looked like he was being hounded for some cash.  Beware.

Great atmosphere! Good food! Nice people! One of the few great places in the Bronx. I recommend this place. Birthday cheers are pretty cool too. Came here tonight and heard maybe 5 birthday chants. Unique from the typical birthday shoutouts in other restaurants.

I asked around where to go for my first visit to the true little Italy of NY and everyone pointed me in the direction of this restaurant.  Given the line going down the street at 4 o'clock on a Saturday outside it's doors, I think everyone seems to agree that this is the place to go.   It was a great experience overall, and a good meal, but nothing about the food lived up to this restaurants name. The bread was good, but not warm. The portions were not large, which I liked because it's the first time I finished a meal and felt great afterward. I had the rigatoni seafood medley special, which was good but it had this delicious yellow sauce but it barely had any seafood in it. The scallop pieces were incredibly fresh and delicious, the clams were teeeeeeny tiny and there were only five of them, and then the shrimp, let's just say those really lived up to their name. They were so tiny and few in number and tasted like they were straight out of a defrost bag.  My friends were not very happy with their veal scalloping. The pasta with meatballs was definitely the winner at the table.  Sooo summary.  Food ok/good but nothing to remember. Service was great. And ambiance was truly wonderful.  Little cave like hallway and one large open room that felt like you were sitting in a small Italian village.  I would recommend it for the experience but would def try the other restaurants instead for my next visit.
It feels like a traditional italian restaurant. Very nice dinner area in the back of the house with live cooking. Service and Pizzas are okay. I like it!

I'm a fan of Roberto's and like to come here when I'm in the mood for something a little more casual and in need of a soup fix! I love getting the Zuppa di Scarole e Fagioli. The inside has fun decor looks like the streets of Italy- posters and trompe l'oeil galore! The pizzas are good, but I feel as though Pepe's is comparable and maybe a little on the salty side.
This place is awesome!Delicious food, outstanding service, and good wine selection! I loved everything about Trattoria Zero Otto Nove!!!!Just go - you won't be disappointed!!!!

After a day of wandering the streets of Arthur Avenue, my friends and I had a GREAT meal here at Zero Otto Nove!We sat at the bar, and we served by the bartender Anthony, who was incredibly friendly and tolerated me wanting to practice up on my Italian while we were there. Not only was his service incredible, everything from the drinks to the food and the coffee at the end of the meal was perfect!We wanted to have multiple courses, so one friend and I split every dish that came out, and Anthony expertly split the plate right in front of us, taking the time and care to make sure each small plate got plated as beautifully as the original plate was. The Mozzarella Caprese was made with some of the best fresh mozzarella and ripe tomatoes I've had in a while.
